image.altText: A man with pointy hair and maroon t-shirt smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: A man accused of the shooting murder of South Australian police officer Jason Doig has been found mentally incompetent by the state's Supreme Court.

title.children: Man charged over SA police officer's death found mentally incompetent

image.altText: Gloved hands holding COVID-19 vaccine, needle in glass container.

props.synopsis: Three local councils in South Australia have been passing motions questioning vaccines, but health experts say they are based on misinformation and heighten community risk.

title.children: Councils under fire for promoting vaccine scepticism

image.altText: A woman wearing sunglasses running on the road

props.synopsis: A trip to the hospital and some badly mangled feet couldn't stop Amber Bryant as she ran from Adelaide to Broken Hill to raise funds and awareness for endometriosis.

title.children: Runner completes 500km in the dark for endometriosis awareness

image.altText: A man in a maroon collared shirt is pictured seating

props.synopsis: At this year’s federal election, the South Australian seat of Boothby is one of the state’s two marginal seats. As part of the ABC’s “Your Say” campaign, we spoke to residents in the electorate about their biggest concerns.

title.children: Boothby is a relatively wealthy electorate, but voters still worry about the cost of living

image.altText: Aliir Aliir of Port Adelaide catches a ball during an AFL game.

props.synopsis: The Swans are trying to find out if the fan who through an object over the fence at Port Adelaide's Aliir Aliir during their AFL clash is a member.

title.children: AFL fan removed by police after throwing object at Aliir

image.altText: Audience members in a red-lit room with screen at front saying Byron underground film festival.

props.synopsis: As streaming sees more and more people forgoing traditional cinemas to watch content at home, micro-cinemas showing alternative and niche films are rising in popularity across the country.

title.children: Micro-cinema subculture emerges as traditional audience streams at home

image.altText: A grey feral cat looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Research tracking released bilbies and bettongs in remote SA has found feral cats are their biggest killer.

title.children: Feral cats killing more native animals than previously thought

image.altText: A large black and white cruise ship with a tug on the water.

props.synopsis: A luxury cruise ship will stop in Wallaroo in 2027, carrying almost 500 passengers, renewing the town's hope of benefiting from the cruise industry.

title.children: Cruise ships to return to SA's Copper Coast after seven-year hiatus

image.altText: A chef.

props.synopsis: In Japan, it's called "shokunin", and it might be the reason why Tokyo is now the world's culinary capital.

title.children: This 96-year-old Tokyo chef has spent his entire life perfecting just one dish

image.altText: A young woman wearing right stares ahead with a sombre look.

props.synopsis: Lucy Savage has to drive 450 kilometres multiple times a month to access specialised care — a reality for many women living with endometriosis and chronic gynaecological conditions around the country.

title.children: The travel toll of living with endometriosis in regional Australia

image.altText: A drone shot of a crash at a highway intersection. Grey smoke is billowing from the two trucks surrounded by police cars

props.synopsis: A South Australian truck driver has been charged with causing death by dangerous driving after a fatal truck crash. Police are urging any witnesses to speak with investigators.

title.children: Truck driver arrested after fatal crash on South Australian highway

image.altText: Pope in open casket

props.synopsis: The 88-year-old pope died on Monday, a day after greeting crowds of worshippers at the Vatican on Easter Sunday. As it happened.

title.children: First images of Pope Francis in an open casket released as cardinals meet

image.altText: A large crowd of people are gathered in a square with the Vatican Obelisk in the background.

props.synopsis: From Italy to Mexico, large crowds gathered around the world, to mourn the death of the pontiff.

title.children: In pictures: Pope Francis mourners gather in vigils around the world

image.altText: Pope Francis and Donald Trump shake hands in front of a press pack.

props.synopsis: In the hours after his death, it has become commonplace to posit Francis as a “progressive” Pope disavowing the conservatism of his predecessors but in reality he was in line with Catholic social teaching.

title.children: As the most credible foil to Trump, Pope Francis leaves a geopolitical hole

image.altText: A man in Islamic garb with a beard stands in Sydney's CBD looking at the camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: A former ASIO spy is breaking his cover to expose the activities of a notorious preacher at the centre of Australia's resurgent pro-Islamic State network.

title.children: Sydney preacher exposed as spiritual leader for Australian pro-IS network

image.altText: A bundle of leaflets held together by yellow tape. The title says Allegra Spender Exposed

props.synopsis: Unauthorised pamphlets attacking independent MP Allegra Spender have been circulating in her electorate, calling her "weak" on antisemitism.

title.children: Who is behind 47,000 anonymous pamphlets attacking Allegra Spender?

image.altText: Two people in orange shirts hand election material to a man in a red shirt

props.synopsis: Voters in the small remote community of Pirlangimpi on the Tiwi Islands, north of Darwin, have become some of the first to cast their votes for the federal election.

title.children: In Pirlangimpi, a long way from Canberra, voters are keen to have their voices heard

image.altText: New Zealand Foreign Minister Winston Peters gestures in a close-up in front of a New Zealand flag.

props.synopsis: New Zealand's populist party has introduced a bill to parliament to define women and men by their biology, preventing trans people from being recognised by law.

title.children: New Zealand populist party bill to define men and women by biology

image.altText: Meteor thumb

props.synopsis: A bright green ball of fire that caused a sonic boom and lit up the night sky from southern Queensland to New South Wales overnight was most likely a meteor, says an astrophysicist.

title.children: Fireball that lit up night sky likely a meteor, says astrophysicist

image.altText: Man in car with another man in suit, with microphones

props.synopsis: Former Australian Test cricketer and television host Michael Slater has been sentenced to four years in prison yet has walked free after already serving more than a year in custody.

title.children: Former Test cricketer Michael Slater free after strangulation, assault sentence

image.altText: Alexa Leary reacts with her mouth wide open

props.synopsis: Alexa Leary twice swam under her previous world record time in the S9 100m freestyle at the Australian Open Swimming Championships in Brisbane.

title.children: Alexa Leary smiles her way to another world record

image.altText: Kylie Truswell-Mobbs and David Mobbs smile while sitting next to each other with their heads together at a restaurant.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors told the court Brisbane woman Kylie Truswell-Mobbs injected her husband, who was in the final stages of Motor Neurone Disease, with pain medication for "the sole purpose of killing him".

title.children: Woman charged with killing terminally ill husband denied bail

image.altText: Cassius lies on his back with puppies sitting on his chest

props.synopsis: A man accused of murdering Cassius Turvey is a "liar" who had no justification in striking the Perth teenager with a trolley pole, a prosecutor tells the WA Supreme Court.

title.children: 'Good on him' if Cassius Turvey stabbed accused killer, prosecutor tells trial

image.altText: Police officers look inspect crashed red car on a highway.

props.synopsis: Tewantin man Bradley Donald Towle, 41, allegedly behind yesterday's fatal crash and a string of carjackings, has been charged with 15 offences. He will appear in court tomorrow.

title.children: Alleged carjacker charged over fatal Sunshine Coast crash, shooting

image.altText: A mean wearing a blue shirt speaks on a microphone, with a teal and blue campaign sign behind him.

props.synopsis: Phil Scott was a prominent anti-fracking activist prior to running for the NT seat of Solomon, with Coalition frontbencher Jacinta Nampijinpa Price accusing him of behaving "like a petulant child".

title.children: Climate 200-backed candidate 'unhinged', Jacinta Nampijinpa Price says

image.altText: Starters' blocks on a rain-soaked grass track at the Stawell Gift.

props.synopsis: Victorian athletics officials say they may have to review the benchmark time used for handicapping the Stawell Gift and other races, after the failure of Lachlan Kennedy and Gout Gout to reach the final.

title.children: Stawell Gift winner says 11m handicap 'totally fair' despite criticism

image.altText: An unidentified woman sitting on the floor with a calculator and bills around her

props.synopsis: If you’ve got an unexpected bill to pay or large expense and you don’t have the money to cover it, here’s what you can do.

title.children: Expert advice if you're short on money that won't leave you worse off

image.altText: composite Dutton Poilievre

props.synopsis: Recent polls have shown the opposition leaders in Australia and Canada moving from a strong position to become election underdogs in recent months. There's one major contributing factor.

title.children: Trump's shadow looms large over Australian and Canadian elections

image.altText: Pete Hegseth scratches the right of his forehead near his hairline with his left thumb as he sits at a table near a man.

props.synopsis: After another Signal controversy, there is mounting pressure on US Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth and reports of "dysfunction" and "mass chaos" inside the Pentagon.

title.children: 'Chaos' and 'dysfunction' reign inside Pete Hegseth's Pentagon

image.altText: A woman with short white hair in a navy blue and white stripped button-down shirt stands on a footpath smiling.

props.synopsis: For Deb Stevens Burrangiri aged care respite facility in Canberra's south was a "lifeline" as her mother's dementia progressed, but the ACT's Health Minister says it's unlikely the facility will be the recipient of a promised $10 million federal funding boost should an Albanese government be re-elected.

title.children: Deb wants her 'lifeline' funded but the health minister say it's unlikely

image.altText: Gryan Miers is helped from the ground by Geelong medical staff as Hawthorn's Conor Nash watches

props.synopsis: Hawthorn midfielder Conor Nash is sent straight to the AFL Tribunal after being reported for striking Geelong forward Gryan Miers.

title.children: Nash set for hefty ban with high hit on Miers sent straight to tribunal

props.synopsis: Pope Francis has died. The Vatican announced his death on Easter Monday. He appeared at St Peter’s Square to bless thousands of people on Easter Sunday just hours before his death.

title.children: Pope Francis’s death and legacy

image.altText: Noah Balta, wearing a black gurnsey with yellow sash, celebrates next to the goal post

props.synopsis: Richmond footballer Noah Balta has been ordered to adhere to a curfew as part of his sentence for assaulting a man in a Mulwala car park last year.

title.children: Court curfew order rules Balta out of Anzac eve AFL clash

image.altText: NSW Police at Bankstown address where woman kidnapping took place

props.synopsis: The woman's male partner's alleged involvement with organised crime is being investigated, said police, with two children known to the woman remaining in hospital under police guard.

title.children: Partner of woman found dead in burnt-out car had 'conflict' with crime group, police say
